Private Member Functions

 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (LayerDrawer)

Detailed Description

A Drawer that manages an array of other Drawers.

These are drawn in array order, so the element with the largest index will be drawn on top.

It can be defined in an XML file with the <layer-list> element. Each Drawer in the layer is defined in a nested <item>.

Definition at line 28 of file LayerDrawer.h.

int32_t gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer::getOpacity ( ) const [virtual]

Return the opacity/transparency of this Drawer.

Generally a Drawer should be as conservative as possible with the value it returns. For example, if it contains multiple child drawers and only shows one of them at a time.

Note that the returned value does not take into account a custom alpha that has been applied by the client through the setAlpha methods.

Returns:
int32_t The opacity class of the Drawer.

Implements gaia::graphics::Drawer.

bool gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer::getPadding ( Rect *  padding) const [virtual]

Return in padding the insets suggested by this Drawer for placing content inside the drawer's bounds.

Positive values move toward the center of the Drawer (set Rect::inset). Returns true if this drawer actually has a padding, else false. When false is returned, the padding is always set to 0.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

bool gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer::isStateful ( ) const [virtual]

Indicates whether this widget will change its appearance based on state.

Clients can use this to determine whether it is necessary to calculate their state and call setState.

Returns:
True if this widget changes its appearance based on state, false otherwise.
See also:
setState(const gaia::base::Array<int32_t>&)

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

void gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer::setAlpha ( int32_t  alpha) [virtual]

Specify an alpha value for the drawer.

0 means fully transparent, and 255 means fully opaque.

Implements gaia::graphics::Drawer.

void gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer::setColorFilter ( const ColorFilter *  cf) [virtual]

Specify an optional colorFilter for the drawer.

Pass null to remove any filters.

Implements gaia::graphics::Drawer.

void gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer::setDither ( bool  dither) [virtual]

Set to true to have the drawer dither its colors when drawn to a device with fewer than 8-bits per color component.

This can improve the look on those devices, but can also slow down the drawing a little.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

Parameters:

bool gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer::setVisible ( bool  visible,
bool  restart 
) [virtual]

Set whether this Drawer is visible.

This generally does not impact the Drawer's behavior, but is a hint that can be used by some Drawers, for example, to decide whether run animations.

Parameters:
visibleSet to true if visible, false if not.
restartYou can supply true here to force the drawer to behave as if it has just become visible, even if it had last been set visible. Used for example to force animations to restart.
Returns:
boolean Returns true if the new visibility is different than its previous state.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.
